Lack of understanding: Some individuals may not fully understand the details of the policy or how it will affect them, leading to confusion and mistrust.
Lack of resources: Implementing a new policy may require additional resources, such as funding, personnel, and infrastructure, which may not be readily available.
Resistance from special interest groups: Special interest groups may have a vested interest in the status quo and may actively work to undermine the implementation of the policy.

Implementation challenges: The process of implementing a new policy can be complex and may involve overcoming a variety of challenges, such as bureaucratic red tape and lack of support from key stakeholders.
Inadequate communication: If the government fails to effectively communicate the policy to the public, it may lead to misunderstandings and mistrust.
